data.author: Chris Iverach-Brereton
data.message:
Fix SLAM parameter passing (#631)

* Instead of manually remapping topics, rewrite the parameters to apply namespaces as needed

* Add map_name parameter to the config so we can overwrite it correctly

data.message: Update github CI, issue templates

data.author: Chris Iverach-Brereton
data.message: Update the SLAM launch file so it works with the latest version of slam_toolbox. Rather than re-impementing all of the launch file, just include the online_sync or online_async launch files as appropriate

data.author: Chris Iverach-Brereton
data.message: True -> true

data.author: Chris Iverach-Brereton
data.message:
Update nav2 launch configuration to work with the latest jazzy:
- syntax update (/ -> ::)
- add docking_server parameters
- make sure enable_stamped_cmd_vel is true
- path follower plugin dwb_core::DWBLocalPlanner -> nav2_mppi_controller::MPPIController
Tested & working in simulation. Not yet tested on physical robot (waiting on firmware update)

data.author: Chris Iverach-Brereton
data.message: Use base_footprint link as the tf base for slam & localization

data.author: Chris Iverach-Brereton
data.message: Remove the base_footprint visualization

data.author: Chris Iverach-Brereton
data.message: Turns out the warning about the lidar being limited to 180 degrees is a mistake, and you _actually_ do get 360 degrees

data.author: Chris Iverach-Brereton
data.message: Add base_footprint link with a simple circle visualization for Rviz

data.author: Chris Iverach-Brereton
data.message: The lidar is mounted sideways; restrict the FoV to the robot's front arc, not the sensor's

data.author: Chris Iverach-Brereton
data.message: Limit the simulated RP Lidar to 180 degrees (the max supported by the plugin)

data.author: Hilary Luo
data.message: Update username for github issue asignment (#361)

data.author: Hilary Luo
data.message:
Issue forms (#315)

* Update issue templates to use form interface and changed assignees

* Force issues to be created using the templates

* Updating CI package versions

* Added new troubleshooting form to differentiate between requests for troubleshooting help and actual bugs

* Ask for the impact and motivation of requests to help with prioritization

* Rename with numbers to control the order in which they are shown to the user

data.author: Roni Kreinin
data.message:
Power off robot at low battery:
- Starts 60s power off timer at 12%
- Timer is cancelled if robot is placed on dock
- Blink lightring red between 12% and 20%
- Battery LED is solid red between 12% and 20%, blinking red below 12%
